string.name: default_notification_channel_name
string.defintion: This is the name users will see under Android system settings for app notifications. It should describe the category of notifications that will be sent through this channel.

string.name: allegiance_option_human
string.definition: Label for the radio button indicating human allegiance.

string.name: allegiance_option_zombie
string.definition: Label for the radio button indicating zombie allegiance.

string.name: allegiance_option_undeclared
string.definition: Label for the radio button indicating undeclared allegiance.

string.name: allegiance_option_everyone
string.definition: Label for the radio button indicating no allegiance filter.

string.name: allegiance_status_alive
string.definition: Status indicating the player is alive.

string.name: allegiance_status_dead
string.definition: Status indicating the player is a zombie.

string.definition: Error message shown when a game name already exists.

string.definition: Button to add selected item to a list or group.

string.definition: Button to set field to selected item.

string.name: button_submit
string.definition: Button to select when saving changes.

string.name: button_refresh
string.definition: Refresh button.

string.name: button_use
string.definition: Button to select when saving changes.

string.definition: Toolbar title for the admin chat list view.

string.name: chat_room_toolbar
string.definition: Toolbar title for the chat room view if the room name won't load.

string.name: chat_info_add_player
string.definition: Option to add a player to the chat room.

string.name: chat_info_title
string.definition: Title for the chat info page.

string.name: chat_info_leave
string.definition: Option to leave the chat room.

string.name: chat_info_leave_dialog_title
string.definition: Title for dialog confirming user wants to leave chat room.

string.name: chat_info_leave_dialog_description
string.definition: Dialog message informing user they can't rejoin chat room after leaving.

resources.string: This can\'t be undone, you\'ll have to ask someone else to add you back.

string.name: chat_info_leave_dialog_with_admins_description
string.definition: Dialog message informing user they can rejoin chat room after leaving.

resources.string: You can rejoin, just click chat with an admin again.

string.name: chat_info_leave_dialog_confirmation
string.definition: Confirmation button for leave chat dialog.

plurals.name: chat_info_member_count
plurals.definition: String expressing the number of members in the chat room.

string.name: chat_info_notifications_option
string.definition: Option to enable/disable notifications in the chat room.

string.name: chat_info_remove_dialog_title
string.definition: Title for dialog confirming user wants to remove player from chat room.

string.name: chat_info_remove_dialog_description
string.definition: Dialog message informing user they can't rejoin chat room after removing player.

resources.string: They can\'t rejoin by themselves. They\'ll have to ask someone else to add them back.

string.name: set_allegiance_warning
string.definition: Warning text about changing a player's allegiance.

resources.string: Be careful, changing this will cause the player to be added and removed from the appropriate groups based on their new allegiance. Note that if a player is already human and you set them to human again THEY WILL GET A ADDITIONAL LIFECODE. That means the zombie can still redeem their old lifecode and get points but this player will stay human. Players are human until ALL of their lifecodes are claimed. Setting a zombie to be a zombie does nothing. Weird things could happen if you set a player to be undeclared; maybe it will be fine and maybe it will break?
